Params: The sound of a downpour is echoing in the deepest part of her memories and M.I.N.D.
Constructs are not bothered by rain. Still, Chiko takes out her coat and puts it above their heads, just like what ordinary humans would do.

Her friend's complaint has caught Bianca's attention. She looks at the female in front of her. As chilling raindrops fall on her arm, her vision and other senses are slowly restored. She realizes Chiko is pulling her as they are both running in the rain.
Also, the ending of that movie was so terrible.
Really? I kinda like it. "If laws are no longer enforced, I shall punish the evil in the name of God. But will such killing violate God's heavenly laws...?"
It was just a movie. Why did it have to make the audience question the meaning of morals and ethics in the end? If the director couldn't find an answer himself, he shouldn't throw the question to us.
True... According to that ending, we are probably the first to be punished by the heavenly laws.
Hah, you are still talking like this...
The two have stopped in front of the train station. The rail splits into two ways.
This era is so absurd that it forces us to kill our most important ones with our own hands. The world needs us, so the remaining humans won't have to suffer what we go through.
Chiko lets out a familiar, carefree smile.
When did Bianca hear these words...? Was it also raining on that day?
The train has arrived with a sharp squeal, but a war has broken out deep in Bianca's eyes.
The peaceful scene is no more. Bianca finds herself holding her bow, standing on the battlefield full of smoke and corpses. A foul, rotten smell has occupied her nasal sensor.
The grey sky continues to drizzle. Human blood and Construct vital fluid have formed a small puddle at her feet. The sound of raindrops hitting the water resonates like her heartbeat.
In front of her is a deformed Construct with a face similar to Chiko's. She is almost consumed in flames that represent the infection of the Punishing Virus.
The infected Construct twists in agony like a tormented soul walking out of the flames of sin. She has completely turned into a monster, still stumbling toward Bianca.
If only I was less hesitant and killed my sister on that day... Those people might not have had to die.
But when I saw her cry... I hesitated.
I was never good at letting go...

More Corrupted and deserters have walked out of the crimson rain, mumbling words of begging or insult. The voice of these executed lives has ultimately merged and turned into a grievous scream that is repeated over and over again.

Bianca hears Chiko's whisper. Her friend wraps her arms around her from behind and takes her hand, putting a blood-stained gun in her palm. Chiko's arm rests next to hers. She points the gun at the deceased.
...My frailty and hesitation caused irreparable sacrifice and tragedy. To amend my mistake, I had to kill more people who were important.
Bianca and Chiko's memories and silhouettes have blended together... They swing the sword toward those who were once their comrades.
In the end, we both chose the same path.
The blade slices through the air, splashing some liquid on Bianca's cheek. It is not blood, but a murky fluid with a strong, pungent odor of machine oil.

A member of the Purifying Force lies before Bianca. She feels like she has returned to that snowfield many years ago, when she killed the Father. White mist has blurred her vision, chilling wind blows her breath away.

She puts down the gun, taking heavy, deep breaths. Through the snow storm she can see many corpses nearby. Some of them belong to Corrupted, some belong to her comrades who were killed before they were completely infected by the Punishing Virus.
My family, friends and comrades... I have been walking over their dead bodies.
Bianca <//CHIKO> gazes down at the bodies in the snow.
When I first heard about Bianca's story, I was actually thinking... If only I could be as cruel as you when I faced a similar situation.
The "body" on the snow staggers to its feet and raises its head, with its face constantly changing. Some faces come from Bianca's memory, some from Chiko's.
Before I realized, I had already stepped on a journey of no return. No matter which side I chose, I would fail the other; I could only continue forward carefully with a guilty feeling.

But this guilt was too heavy for me to carry, for emotions could rule over rational judgment. Ever since then, I chose the easiest way to live: I treated everything with zero emotion to maximize the result. Without humanity, life no longer felt "painful."

Warm liquid continues to roll down her face. Bianca <//CHIKO> touches it and realizes it is not blood, but a transparent fluid. It has been too long since she had a human body. She has almost forgotten the feeling of tears.
Another Purifying Force member is questioning.
Does it even have any place in such a world?
He erupts into a burst of furious laughter, as if he has just heard an absurd joke.

I can't believe you still hold such a naive, ridiculous belief as the captain of the Purifying Force... You are only going to make others believe that the battles are worth fighting. Killing is just killing. Having such unnecessary morals will only make them die in vain!
Sacrifice is inevitable in war. Anyone should be aware and prepared for it before stepping on the battlefield!
But because we are not mere killing machines, there are some values we must uphold. Without bottom lines, the cruelty of wars will only continue to increase, bringing even more sacrifices.
One day, such a vicious cycle will distort everything we fight for.
You are trying to find goodness in hell. It will never change the nature of war!
Goodness isn't necessarily linked to humanity. Even humanity itself has multiple distinct dimensions of values. None of them can be directly equated to life.

Holding a weapon doesn't grant us the ability to judge the value of life. We may find ourselves in hell, but that only makes it more important to not trade our bottom lines for a brief moment of peace.
If only your theories can stop the war.
The tone of the soldier is no longer filled with anger, but rather exhaustion. He casts one last glance at Bianca. Instead of continuing the argument, he just slams the door and leaves.
What about you, Bianca? Do you also think I'll make a better leader of the Purifying Force?
Chiko shows up on a bench in the Purifying Force's lounge. She quietly looks at Bianca.
Everyone acknowledges your strength and your decisive style.
They just admire the strong. But my strength came from the fact that I was willing to sacrifice everything.
Killing is evil. Each time I made a decision to kill, darkness haunted me.
But you'll never see yourself as innocent. You won't conveniently blame the Punishing Virus or the wrongdoings in this world.
You understand your sins very well. Knowing that you are on the way to hell, you still can't help but to respond to the voices asking for help.
When you know they are beyond redemption, you can still execute them with your very own hands and carry on with this guilt.
Is this what they said in the movie? "We are all alerted about the evil ones. But there is another evil that we must beware. It is the indifference of the kind-hearted."
Bianca, your rare, precious mind will never be corrupted by the outside world... That's what I envy most about you, for I myself am always indifferent.
The train has arrived at the station. Chiko gently tidies up the hair near Bianca's ears.
Sorry for saying so much. I couldn't help it.
Still, it's nice to talk to you like this in the end.
Bianca looks back into Chiko's eyes and sees her own silhouette. The original look of this frame is actually the "Witch" side of her.
There are more emotions in Chiko's eyes that Bianca finds somewhat familiar. She saw them on that snowfield many years ago.
Chiko didn't say anything else. She stepped on the unnamed train and waved goodbye to Bianca... Just like a friend saying "See you tomorrow."
It is just another ordinary day. After missions, the always-serious Chiko would return to the Purifying Force's lounge and smile to Bianca.
...They will then have a simple chat in the lounge. Occasionally, they would watch a movie from the Golden Age together during their vacation.
Bianca wakes up from the dream of farewell. The deviation of her M.I.N.D. has temporarily stabilized.
She opens her eyes and realizes the restart process of her frame has completed. She finds herself in an undamaged corner of the aquarium, with some Red Tide remaining around.
There is still some warmth left on her cheek. Next to her is a pair of earrings that once belonged to Chiko, telling her that "she" has been here.
Bianca has no time for anything else. She quickly holds the Phantom Tracer up, trying to look for traces of the past.
The petite girl silently gazes at the Hetero-Humanoid curled up amidst the Red Tide. This terrifying creature was significantly wounded during the tragic battle it fought with Liv.
Now only the female Hetero-Creature is barely surviving. It is immersed in the Red Tide like a fetus floating in the amniotic fluid.
Only the remains of the Hetero-Humanoid were retrieved. Even after the Red Tide had repaired them, there was only an empty shell left.
But that's okay... It's enough as an experiment subject.
If this project can work... Many who are unable to become Constructs can still embrace a more complete rebirth.
Correct. If you want to get rid of that body incompatible with Constructs to live a new life... You should merge yourself with her.
But will I still be myself?
...Do you think you have another option?
The never-ending escape. The Red Tide and Corrupted... You fear death, yet you don't know when it will arrive.
You are willing to believe in anything just to survive... Be it God, or the weapon in your hand. Isn't that right?
You lied to many people and made them come here. You knew it well long ago.
If you can revive in her body, your words, divination and identity will all be verified. You no longer need to fear the Punishing Virus either. Isn't that good?
Come, Grace. This is an obstacle you must overcome to bid farewell to your long-lasting fear.
Just when Grace takes a step toward her ending, the closed door is slammed open.
More Purifying Force soldiers swarm in and surround the two. Holding their weapons, they are all alerted and dare not go any closer.
Out of the way! Do you want to get killed by this Ascendant?!
That's Lithos the Swindler... Are you really going to trust his words?!
Run, while you are still alive!
Lithos remains calm. He turns to the fully armed Purifying Force soldiers.
This is the Hetero-Humanoid... So you brought it here. Are you trying to run another dirty experiment with it?
Chiko sneers with a furrowed brow. She exchanges a look with Norris, and the latter immediately understands her instruction.
—Kill Lithos and eliminate all possible means for the Hetero-Humanoid to revive.

Chiko's words seem to have touched on a forbidden topic. Lithos rises to his feet from the execution chair, and everyone can feel his invisible rage. The ground underneath begins to tremble, as if some sort of waves are surging toward them.
Compared with what those people did... I'm far from being dirty, or a "Swindler".
Yet, you are taking their side and fighting to protect them.
Don't worry. I have no interest in fighting for revenge.
However... Since you described this project as "dirty," I shall make you experience this dirty in person, although it's not even half as horrible as what they did.
—The battle has ended. Most Purifying Force soldiers have been devoured by the Hetero-Creatures that came from the deep sea, leaving no remains.
Enough... Kill me now if you want to.
Chiko was seriously wounded in the battle. Strangled by a fish-like Hetero-Creature, she ceases struggling but gives Lithos a cold stare without any fear.
You aren't waiting for me to beg for mercy, are you? I know Ascendants all have their weird hobbies.
...I don't have any of the weird hobbies you mentioned.
I hate to see you suffer, even if you are my enemy.
Come, I'll give you a new life right now.
Don't be scared... It will be a happy dream.

Despite finally revealing a glimpse of emotional vulnerability, Chiko fails to elicit even a hint of sympathy from the Ascendant. Perhaps Lithos believes what he is doing is already an action of sympathy.
That human has fled. You shall help me complete this experiment.
He manipulates Chiko, pressing her against the fetus-like humanoid.
Now, pray. If this project succeeds, your life will be carried by a higher life form.
The flashback comes to an abrupt stop, freezing at the moment that Chiko melts into a Hetero-Humanoid.
What was the look on her face? Was she in fear, or determined as always? Or... perhaps she was a little unwilling to go?
Bianca does not know. The illusion of Chiko has been rewound to the moment Bianca first stepped in, staring at her in silence.
Finally figuring everything out, Bianca knows this place is where Chiko was lost, and also where the Hetero-Humanoid—now with Chiko's mind inside—saved her.
She hugs Chiko's illusion. It disappears in her arms, as if it has been waiting for this very moment all along.

Behind the illusion is a large glass wall of the aquarium. Bianca sees her own reflection in it. The Punishing Virus has eroded and peeled off the coating of Stigmata, revealing another look of her: a witch holding a Swordstaff.
But considering that a familiar appearance can help stabilize the M.I.N.D., we made this coating in response to the short production time of the frame...
Bianca rubs the hair around her ears. The first time she met Chiko, she also helped her to do the same. "Now you finally look like the captain of the Purifying Force," she said.

Bianca ties up her long hair and puts on the earrings Chiko left her. She wipes out the blood stain around her mouth, cleans her coating, and then waves goodbye to where Chiko's illusion was standing.
My existence has never changed. That's why I still cannot laugh at you... Sorry, Chiko.
Bianca closes her eyes, recalling all the memories and emotions that Chiko passed to her.
But I will accept the changes within myself...

When Bianca opens her eyes again, there is only resolution in them. She has accepted everything of herself, and revived in the darkness as a "Witch". She picks up the weapon born in the darkness and leaves the aquarium that is about to collapse, heading toward the light on the ocean's surface.
